availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Lewis Martin and Nancy A. E. Martin. Married to Nancy E. Martin. Father of Mary L. Martin, James W. Martin, Nancy Martin, and John H. Martin. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 397A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 26.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 6, p. 160A.
"William Hampton Martin Sr. (1828-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial #5044574, accessed April 15, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5044574.
